title: polynomials - Decompose a power of the radius as a sum of squares of forms
body: I am interested in a decomposition $$(x_1^2+...+ x_n^2)^d=\sum_{i=1}^m (P_i(x_1,\dots,x_n))^2$$ where $d>1$ is odd, $m\leq n$ , $P_i$ are forms of degree $d$ . Of course, the greatest common divisor for all $P_i$ is 1, to prevent the trivial decomposition with $P_i=x_i(x_1^2+...+ x_n^2)^{(d-1)/2}$ . polynomials Share Cite Improve this question Follow asked Jul 29, 2020 at 15:51 Arimakat 333 2 2 silver badges 7 7 bronze badges $\endgroup$ Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
